content.description: Follow first three bolts of I Say  Ouday then skip left, clipping one bolt, then Habudabi's anchor, then continue traversing up and left for several more bolts.  Eventually you will reach a large ledge with a bolt above it on the bulge.  DO NOT pull the tempting bulge as I did, no more bolts await. Instead, traverse left several feet to anchors around the corner.  Have your belayer follow and clean or prepare to get very frustrated attempting to do it on your own.
content.location: Branching left off of I Say Ouday.

content.description:
The climbing does not let up much with the crux at about 60% height. Tall people can rest below the crux by stemming across the chasm.

The belaying area is somewhat steep and loose. The route enjoys partial shade from the rock behind it, in the morning, then again in the afternoon. This is a nice group of moderately graded routes, especially together with the routes around Bombs over Baghdad.
content.location: The route is about 10 feet left of This Scud's For You. It is situated near the top of the small chasm walking up to Bombs over Baghdad. TSFY goes thru the obvious narrowing of the chasm at 40' height.

content.description:
This is an excellent route with a couple of steeper sections in an apparent slab. Climbs the face opposite Bullets and I Say Ouday. Very worthwhile.

This route was originally a one-pitch route. Jason and Noah Stevens added two additional pitches on 12.9.17. A 70M rope is required.

P1: Climb the steepest 5.6 on earth to anchors.

P2: From the anchors, take two steps up and right into a pod. Continue right round a rib and clip the anchors on a project route. Continue right, climbing bolts up a rib and through a vertical section right of an overhang. 5.7 40'

P3: This pitch requires a 70M rope. Climb low angle rock and huge cobbles up the corner of the formation to a three anchor belay station located 20' short of the true summit. If you want to stand on top, continue 20' to the true summit where a single bolt will protect you while you enjoy the views. 120', 5.2. Rap the route.

Variation:

If you want to avoid the crux on the second pitch, climb unprotected easy rock above and slightly left of the anchors. Be careful to not kick any loose rock down on your belayer. Stay in a shallow gully and make your way to a two bolt anchor on the wall right of a huge flat-top platform. Belay your partner to this station, then clip up and right out to the corner and follow the bolt line to the summit.
content.location: The route is about 15' left of Bullets over Baghdad. When you start I Say Ouday, it is 12 - 15m behind you.

content.description: A unique climb!  I think it would be classic if only it were longer.  Climb pockets and cobbles to a chimney where you can stem or scum for a no-hands any way you like (head scum, butt scum, you name it).  The anchors lie just above the chimney.
content.location: This route is on the northeast side of the formation, around the corner from the other routes.

content.description: Sweet, bomber cobbles up almost vertical stone.
content.protection: 5 bolts to Metolius steep carabiners. Please TR through your own draws.
content.location: This route faces dues south and is the first route right of the Bullets Over Baghdad arete. It is located immediately left of where the boulders drop into the gully at the climbers right.

content.description: The climb has some 5.6/7 moves in the lower half and again after a small "cave". The anchors are set back which creates friction when lowering off. One can use the anchors to the left which are higher and create less rope drag. A good route.
content.location: This route is about 20' left of This Scud's For You, and 10' left of Scud Unknown Left, on the local high point at the base of the cliff.

content.description: New line of stainless steel bolts that start behind a couple little trees. Now the third line left from Scud.  If this is your route, comment and I’ll add your stuff.
content.location: Starts at the top of the hill, behind a couple little trees that are right at the base of the wall.  You’ll have to crawl around them to get on the wall.

content.description: New route in the area. I unknowingly hopped on this thinking it was TOW Jam. It is not. Crux comes early on (~bolt 3-4). After that, it’s easy jug climbing to the chains.  Felt like an easy 10?
content.location: On the left wall, just right of the two 5.6s. Starts by heading up an obvious short ramp to the first bolt.

content.description:
A decent, longer route on the right end of the Walls of Liberation (WoL) that starts up some unfortunately chossy rock to the first bolt (maybe it'll clean up alright?) and ends with a short-lived and difficult boulder problem bulge up high.

Stick clip the first bolt (because the soft, exfoliating rock kinda sucks to start) and make tenuous moves past the first bolt to the second bolt. From here the rock quality improves but the moves stay sustained past a few more bolts to a no hands rest below the bulge up high. Make a reachy clip on the fixed perma draw and pull difficult moves over the bulge to easier, dirty terrain to the anchors.

[New route, June 2020] As always, new routes anywhere, especially at Maple Canyon, will be dirty, loose, licheny and stuff will come off as the route improves. Wear a helmet and treat suspect holds with respect and trepidation.
content.protection: 10 bolts to a two-bolt anchor with lowering biners. Ninth bolt has a brown perma draw on it.
content.location:
The right-most route on the WoL, just right of the obvious black streak that is

El Rito Simulator

.

content.description: The crux is between the first 4 bolts, then you get a good rest at the huge cobble sticking out of the wall.
content.location: Route starts at the lowest point on the trail between Bullets Over Baghdad and This Scuds for You. If you are scrambling up between the boulders the route is directly behind you.

content.description: Climbs a long slab then crosses left over a small couloir, surmounts a short vertical crux and gains the chains at easier rock.
content.location: First route left of TOW Jam. If you are facing north looking at the arete that forms Bullets Over Baghdad this route is behind you. The route faces east.

content.description: The first 30' of this climb is fairly continuous. Good climbing at the grade (5.7/5.8).
content.protection: 6 bolts + 2 chain anchors. First bolt is no longer 20' off the ground. Recent additions have added 2 new bolts to make this climb more accessible!
content.location: About 30' left of This Scud's For You - on the path up to Bombs over Baghdad.

content.description: Easy climbing with one bulge to pull about half way up.
content.location: Between Habudabi and Bullets Over Bagdad.

content.description: The shortest 5.10 at Maple?  With a steep beginning and a few large moves, this route is over before it even starts.  It can still pump you out though! Don't linger.
content.location: Just right of two red tagged projects.  The farthest left complete route on the wall.

content.description:
Superb, slightly overhanging climbing on great rock and holds up along the edge of the prominent black streak. There's a nice rest out right around bolts 4&5 with a decently long, but safe, run between bolts 5 and 6. Then hang on for a few more bolts to the anchors. The position of this route is fantastic with a commanding view down canyon from the anchors.

The lowering climber should be careful to not kick rocks in the crummy light brown rock area, left of the bolt line, while lowering.
content.protection: 9 bolts to an anchor with lowering hardware
content.location: The far right edge of the Walls of Liberation. It's the second route you'll encounter if taking the primary approach trail up from the dirt road. The route ascends the left edge of the prominent black streak.

content.description: Far and away, the best route on the wall.  Climb the south facing arete on huge holds to the top of the formation.  There is a great ledge to hang out on.  Belay your second up and bring a camera!  It is a great view!  A perfect first lead with closely spaced bolts and solid rock.
content.location: Aesthetic arete right of I Say Ouday.
